hero.title: Cleric-Laic Meeting
hero.subtitle.paragraph.1: Every two years, the Greek community of South America gathers for a unique and meaningful cleric-laic event. This meeting brings together Greeks from various countries in the region to reflect on their identity and strengthen community ties. Over several days, participants enjoy a rich agenda of cultural, religious, and festive activities, which not only celebrate Greek heritage but also promote coexistence and dialogue between generations.
hero.subtitle.paragraph.2: This year, the event will take place in Buenos Aires, Argentina, in November, and promises to be an unforgettable experience. Paving the way for the next meeting to be held in Sao Paolo
schedule.subtitle: Our three-day program is packed with activities, debates, and parties.
schedule.subtitle.paragraph: Accreditations will take place in two different periods: For those arriving on Friday, we have the first accreditation window from 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM, at the Hellenic Community of Buenos Aires - Julián Alvarez. And for those arriving on Saturday, accreditations will be available from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM at the Greek Institute Athenagoras I - Lerma 242, where the opening will subsequently take place.

speakers.title: Debate Tables
speakers.description: This is one of the fundamental stations of the program that imposes itself as a necessity, so that participants and institutions can enrich themselves through free participation - according to their own interests - in debate tables that will cover the two areas of reflection and action that call us - Church and Community. The themes of these debate tables are based on the discussions of the plenaries held at the clergy-laity reunion in Montevideo. This way, the continuation, monitoring, and follow-up of the evolution of reflection and, above all, the execution of the proposals made are guaranteed.
tables.helenic.name: Hellenic Leadership
tables.helenic.speakers.items.0.title: Current Issues
tables.helenic.speakers.items.0.text: Funding and sustainability, Participation and relevance in the community, Integration of new generations.
tables.helenic.speakers.items.1.title: Continuity of Hellenism and Orthodoxy
tables.helenic.speakers.items.1.text: Importance of keeping Hellenic customs and culture alive. Importance of cooperation with the Church in common strategies to maintain faith and culture. Role of institutions as guardians of Hellenic identity and spirituality. Strategies to strengthen the Greek presence in Latin America.
tables.helenic.speakers.items.2.title: Keeping the Greek Language and Orthodoxy Alive
tables.helenic.speakers.items.2.text: Language teaching programs. Challenges and opportunities. Impact on the preservation of faith and culture. Why maintaining faith is a guarantee of the continuation of Hellenism in South America.
tables.helenic.speakers.items.3.title: Being Ambassadors of Greece and Orthodoxy
tables.helenic.speakers.items.3.text: Responsibilities of Hellenic institutions in promoting cultural and spiritual values. Promotion of Greek culture. Maintaining faith. Collaboration with Greek entities.
tables.helenic.speakers.items.4.title: Conclusions and Recommendations
tables.helenic.speakers.items.4.text: Synthesis of key points. Concrete proposals for strengthening institutions and continuing Hellenism and Orthodoxy from the perspective of South American Hellenic leadership.
tables.culture.name: Promotion of Culture
tables.culture.speakers.items.0.title: Challenges in Teaching the Greek Language
tables.culture.speakers.items.0.text: Availability of programs and resources. Teacher training. Integration into the official education system. Reflections and contributions on the current system of sending teachers from Greece.
tables.culture.speakers.items.1.title: Official and Language Schools
tables.culture.speakers.items.1.text: Differences and benefits. Role in promoting Greek culture. Successful experiences and lessons learned.
tables.culture.speakers.items.2.title: Educational Curriculum
tables.culture.speakers.items.2.text: Content and approaches. Adaptation to the needs of new generations. Incorporation of technology and digital resources.
tables.culture.speakers.items.3.title: Conclusions and Recommendations
tables.culture.speakers.items.3.text: Identification of areas for improvement. Proposals to strengthen the teaching and promotion of Greek culture in Latin America. Proposals to improve the current system of sending teachers from Greece.
tables.youth.name: Youth
tables.youth.speakers.items.0.title: Future Leaders
tables.youth.speakers.items.0.text: Commitment to religion, culture, language, and customs. Challenges and opportunities. Training and education for leadership.
tables.youth.speakers.items.1.title: Activities and Exchanges with Greece
tables.youth.speakers.items.1.text: Cultural exchange experiences. Benefits for personal and community development. Promoting the connection with the homeland.
tables.youth.speakers.items.2.title: Promoting Youth Participation
tables.youth.speakers.items.2.text: Strategies to involve more youth. Creation of attractive spaces and activities. Recognition of the role of youth in Hellenic institutions.
tables.youth.speakers.items.3.title: How Does the Church Welcome Youth?
tables.youth.speakers.items.3.text: Strategies to involve more youth in church activities. Catechesis for youth.
tables.youth.speakers.items.4.title: Conclusions and Recommendations
tables.youth.speakers.items.4.text: Reflections on the current commitment of youth. Proposals to strengthen youth participation and leadership in Hellenic communities and in the Church.
tables.orthodoxy.name: Orthodoxy
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.0.title: Hypostasis
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.0.text: Why the presence of the Orthodox Church in South America is necessary. The role of the Orthodox Church in modern societies and how it can set trends. A South American Orthodoxy?
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.1.title: Mission
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.1.text: Mission and Evangelization. Catechesis. Training new local candidates for the priesthood. Liturgical life. Promoting spiritual strategies to address the spiritual crisis of modern South American man. Projecting spiritual dynamics to maintain life values consistent with faith. Raising awareness of the need for the Orthodox Church to contribute to alleviating organic poverty in our countries.
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.2.title: Difficulties
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.2.text: Financing and stewardship. Vocational crises. Agnosticism and spiritual indifference. Lack of coordination and cooperation among different Orthodox jurisdictions in South America. Lack of common testimony.
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.3.title: Challenges
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.3.text: Inclusivity and fidelity to the Gospel and Tradition: the proper and lawful amalgam. Youth as a pastoral and missionary objective of the Church: strategies and difficulties in the mission. Transcending the “religious ghetto” and opening the Church to all peoples. Liturgical accessibility: project of liturgical translations. Legal recognition of the Archdiocese in the countries of its jurisdiction. Recognition of feast days in the various countries of the South American jurisdiction.
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.4.title: Conclusions and Recommendations
tables.orthodoxy.speakers.items.4.text: Synthesis of key points. Concrete proposals to strengthen the archdiocesan institution at all levels to ensure the continuity of Hellenism and Orthodoxy.
